notes: Born November 1st 2099 (Fet Gede - All Souls Day) - 24 years old.
Samuel grew up in the impoverished Port Au Prince commune of Cite
Soleil. This former shantytown grew to house well over one and a
half million souls by 2099. With the deaths of most of his family by
the time he turned 15, Samuel fled with Esther, his younger sister,
to the larger, and wealthier urban center of Port au Prince. To find
He lived hand to mouth doing any kind of work, legal or otherwise,
to support himself and his sister for several years. Befriending a
few of the other homeless they eked out a rough, uneducated
existence. Around his 17th birthday, he met Beatrice Hyppolite, also
known as Missus H. Missus H took the children to her "home" in an
abandoned warehouse, where she acted as a mother figure for her
"Lost Bays (babies)" and began to teach Samuel to read and the
Missus H was also a Vodouisant and head of her small Sosyete. She
encouraged Samuel to join her Sosyete and he picked up a rudimentary
understanding of Vodou. The power of Vodouisants disturbed Samuel
and he began to refuse to join in the Fets. But Missus H insisted
that Samuel had the touch. All the signs were present for him to be
a great Houngan. Missus H told Samuel that his birthday made him a
vessel for a reborn soul and he will forever be connected to the
By 2118, when he was 19, Samuel moved Esther and himself out of
Missus H's home and was able to find a steady, semi-legitimate job
as a night security guard for Professional Security Services (PSS),
a well known and long standing security company with roots in the
20th century. He worked his way through the ranks eventually being
trained in weapons and served as an armed security guard.
Esther took work as a waitress in a nightclub/bar, the Cafe Trio,
and Samuel began to work part-time as a bouncer there. The Trio was
host to several members of Haiti's underground drug traffickers,
most notably Gregory Occeant. Occeant was a regular and a Hounsi.
His wealth and political power derived from the wealth have allowed
him to hire the services of Loveson Jabouin, a powerful Bokor.
A year ago, while Samuel was working a night shift for PSS, Esther
went missing. She was last seen at the Trio speaking with Occeant
and Jabouin. Samuel suspects Occeant and/or Jabouin to be behind
her disappearance but he can't prove it. While trailing Jabouin,
Samuel followed him to his home. After the Bokor had left Samuel
broke in looking for proof or evidence of his sister's whereabouts.
He discovered an awful truth. Jabouin was head of a secret police
force under Occeant and his drug cartel. This group was tasked,
among other duties, with collecting slave labor for the cartel's
Before Samuel could learn more Jabouin returned home. Samuel grabbed
a small leather pouch with an animal skull stitched to the flap. He
recognized this as part of the Bokor's ceremonial paraphernalia,
but Samuel has been too afraid of both the contents of the pouch and
the Bokor to ever open the pouch.
With Jabouin now an enemy Samuel needed to escape Haiti, at the
very least. It was soon after that he came across an ad for security
on the space station Persephone. He sold what possessions he had,
collected his last paycheck and found the nearest recruitment office.
The small pouch with the animal skull was packed in the bottom of
his suitcase and the haunting words of Missus H echo in his mind
whenever he thinks about the bag. "In Haiti, there are secrets we

notes: Requiem is plain looking, with a nose that's just a little too
large for her face, puffy cheeks, and a slightly absent chin.  You
can see a bright, shiny light, though, behind her tiny, squinty
eyes.  There's plenty going on beneath that dowdy surface. Requiem
simply nods by way of greeting.
station history: lifer (born on Earth, this is 1st station)
knack: The attention of supernatural powers
Chief Deputy Marshal Leland Stoddard's face is almost entirely
mustache.  Big, brown, burly and bushy, his mustache dominates
his otherwise hairless head as if it makes up for all that shiny
skin. He presents an imposing presence even though he's only
slightly taller than average, and leanly built. He has the
certainty of purpose that blossoms from the deep understanding
that his will is God's will and his carriage promises an absolute
reckoning if your interests and his don't perfectly align.
He was a gunnery sergeant in the space marines and is known by the
Conglomerate as someone who gets ugly things done.
instincts: To extinguish an evil forever

notes: Talk w/ Konstantin Alexei Mironov (Russian prison tattoos).  He
should arrive on time in a very nice business suit, have an
expensive watch and nice jewelry.  He'll give an extremely firm
handshake and look each person in the eye.  He'll have a very
opulent office, very large, with a view (it's a display of wealth
and power).  He'll lead the party to a formal anteroom with a table
for meals.  He'll remove his shoes before entering (roll for the
party to notice).  Wine and cake (like a fruitcake) will be served
in a very formal way.  He'll have servants serve the food
hierarchically to the guests whom he'll treat with honor and
respect (which he'll expect in return).  He will use each of the
party's title (Officer), first, middle, and last name.  At the meal,
he'll discuss how harsh the conditions are, having a business in
the space station, and how he has overcome it to flourish with
relationships like the one being forged, now.  He'll urge everyone
to take second helpings.  Afterwards, he'll move to his desk where
chairs will be provided for each of the party.  At his desk, he'll
ask a favor of the party: to find out what's in those crates and
to give him this information.  The meeting won't be over until
He values: emotional connection, he's fatalistic and pessimistic,
he'll have fortress mentality.  He'll be direct

station history: lifer (born on Earth, this is 1st station)
Tags: Short, wiry gray hair, anorexic.
Description: An anorexic, mocha-colored lady shimmies out from
behind the pipes, her head bobbing to music only she can hear.
She wears a bright red, floor-length dress on her barely-5-foot
frame and there's a flash of wiry gray hair spilling out from
Cedella's mind is broken by the telepathic slugs.  She sees
people that aren't there, she sees people that are slugs'
projections (avatars), she believes that she's invisible but also
believes that one of her more persistent shades can be seen by
others -- she has open conversations with that one and that's
her communication with the outside world.  When people talk to
her, she thinks they're talking to her shade.
She's aware that some of the people she sees are hallucinations
-- when new people show up, she doesn't know if they're
hallucinations or not.  Her hallucinations (and the avatars) can
read her mind so she'll ask new people a question, the answer to
which they can see around them, and think the wrong answer.  Real
people get the environmental answer but imaginary people get the

notes: Narrow face, mocha skin, high cheekbones, giant close-set eyes,
and jet black lips.  Black and white patterned turban, piled high
on her head.  Large hoop earrings.  Several rings and bracelets.
A dress in indigo and teal satin with billowing skirts, and
voluminous sleeves to the wrist.  A bright turquoise wrap extends
She went to a French finishing school in Port-O-Prince.
Office is a repurposed janitorial closet.  Heavily cluttered with
things sitting on top of things and stuff hanging from the ceiling.
Queen Clio's place is tucked into an alcove that, at one time, was
probably a janitorial closet.  She works at a small writing desk
on the other side of an overflowing bookshelf, both pushed up
against the wall on the left.  There are indigenous drums on the
floor and an African grave marker against the opposite wall,
leaning against an apothecary's cabinet that's supporting upwards
of a dozen human skulls surrounded by candles, tarot cards, and
prayer beads.  What you can see of the walls and ceiling is
painted a dark, deep, indigo interrupted by stars in shining gold
but they're mostly covered by prayer mats and vestments from myriad
religions plus various other items including a weathered chalice,
a few prayer wheels, and a dagger (maybe Egyptian or Sumerian?)
that's covered with a long-dried brown liquid.  A shrunken head
that looks disturbingly real is hanging from the ceiling along
with various stoppered bottles and a number of other things
including a Grecian vase filled with a small bundle of fresh
Office is a repurposed janitorial closet.  There're 13 skulls.
The stars are arranged like those of the Earth's night sky.  The
books on the shelf appear to be leather bound manuscripts with
ancient brass corner caps and buckled closures.  On the bookshelf
are bottles of wine and rum and holy water.  The apothecary's
cabinet contains finger bones, herbs, incense, and a bunch of
other stuff.  This part of the office terminates at an opaque
indigo drape.  Beyond that is her sleeping palette and personal
station history: lifer (born on Earth, this is 1st station)
Tags: Fireplug, square head, thick mop of black hair, always a
broad smile and a twinkle in his eyes
Jorge is a little fireplug of a man with a square head that sits
atop a blacksmith's body.  He has a ready smile and dimples you can
plant a tree in.  He gives you a dazzling grin and says 'Mucho
Dima and his four bodyguards move with the relaxed confidence of
those whose security have been foretold by the gods.  His black
hair and beard, punctuated by patches of gray, are closely cropped
and he wears a dark gray sportcoat over jeans and a black dress
Dislikes Samuel.  He would not drink with him.
Mac's an aboriginal Australian with the characteristic umber
skin; deep-set eyes; wide nose; and giant mop of hair, akimbo.
She sports braces with dental headgear and, commensurate with her
age, has a mild dusting of pimples on her forehead.  Today, like
most days, she's wearing an oversized gray sweatshirt over olive
drab cargo pants and canvas Converse high-tops (covered in cartoon
Mackenzie is 15 years old, 145 lbs, and 5' 2".  She works most days
at the front desk and answering the phones but she also helps with
IT.  Turns out, she's _really_ good at IT and fills-in for the
lazy guy who's in charge of that department.  She's the adopted
child of a white father who is often away on one of the platforms.
She's not chipped (doesn't _have_ to get chipped until next year).
Her dad leaves open accounts for Mac whenever he's off-station.
She's technically a volunteer but she gets cards under the table.
She's an outcast, being one of the very few aborigines in the
project.  She retreats into hacking but also spends some time in
station history: staby (born on this station)
instincts: To bring about unending summer
knack: A key to an important door
Chief deputy Hurley is a big man.  At 6' 2" and massively
corpulent, he looks like he's been poured into his uniform like
it was a sausage casing and, at that, the fabric strains at the
buttons.  In spite of this, though, he moves like someone who's
been large his entire life.  His head is topped by a thick bush
of sandy blonde hair which seems to go perfectly with his dirty
blue eyes.  Mitchell Hurley has a sweet demeanor and tends to get
things done by convincing agreement rather than coersion.
Mambo that leads Masubi-1's Vodou Societe.  She detected the
